Source Code

  1import astroid
  2from astroid import nodes
  3from typing import List, Dict, Any
  4
  5class ML_SmellDetector:
  6    def __init__(self):
  7        self.smells: List[str] = []
  8        self.imports: Dict[str, Any] = {}
  9        self.variables: Dict[str, Any] = {}
 10        self.functions: Dict[str, Any] = {}
 11        self.classes: Dict[str, Any] = {}
 12
 13    def detect_smells(self, file_path: str) -> List[str]:
 14        with open(file_path, 'r') as file:
 15            content = file.read()
 16        module = astroid.parse(content)
 17        self.visit_module(module)
 18        return self.smells
 19
 20    def visit_module(self, node: nodes.Module):
 21        self.check_imports(node)
 22        self.check_data_leakage(node)
 23        self.check_magic_numbers(node)
 24        self.check_feature_scaling(node)
 25        self.check_cross_validation(node)
 26        self.check_imbalanced_dataset(node)
 27        self.check_feature_selection(node)
 28        self.check_metric_selection(node)
 29        self.check_model_persistence(node)
 30        self.check_reproducibility(node)
 31        self.check_data_loading(node)
 32        self.check_unused_features(node)
 33        self.check_overfit_prone_practices(node)
 34        self.check_error_handling(node)
 35        self.check_hardcoded_filepaths(node)
 36        self.check_documentation(node)
 37        
 38
 39    def check_imports(self, node: nodes.Module):
 40        for import_node in node.nodes_of_class((nodes.Import, nodes.ImportFrom)):
 41            if isinstance(import_node, nodes.Import):
 42                for name, alias in import_node.names:
 43                    self.imports[alias or name] = name
 44            elif isinstance(import_node, nodes.ImportFrom):
 45                for name, alias in import_node.names:
 46                    self.imports[alias or name] = f"{import_node.modname}.{name}"
 47
 48    def check_data_leakage(self, node: nodes.Module):
 49        preprocessing_before_split = False
 50        train_test_split = False
 51        
 52        for func in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.FunctionDef):
 53            if any(call.func.as_string().endswith(('fit', 'fit_transform')) for call in func.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call)):
 54                preprocessing_before_split = True
 55            if 'train_test_split' in func.as_string():
 56                train_test_split = True
 57                
 58        if preprocessing_before_split and not train_test_split:
 59            self.smells.append("Potential data leakage: Preprocessing applied before train-test split")
 60
 61    def check_magic_numbers(self, node: nodes.Module):
 62        for assign in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Assign):
 63            if isinstance(assign.value, nodes.Const) and isinstance(assign.value.value, (int, float)):
 64                self.smells.append(f"Magic number detected: {assign.value.value}")
 65
 66    def check_feature_scaling(self, node: nodes.Module):
 67        scaling_methods = ['StandardScaler', 'MinMaxScaler', 'RobustScaler']
 68        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
 69            if any(method in call.func.as_string() for method in scaling_methods):
 70                # This is a simplistic check. In a real scenario, you'd want to ensure consistent use across features.
 71                self.smells.append("Feature scaling detected. Ensure consistent application across features and datasets.")
 72
 73    def check_cross_validation(self, node: nodes.Module):
 74        cv_detected = False
 75        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
 76            if 'cross_val_score' in call.func.as_string() or 'KFold' in call.func.as_string():
 77                cv_detected = True
 78                break
 79        if not cv_detected:
 80            self.smells.append("Cross-validation not detected. Consider using cross-validation for more robust evaluation.")
 81
 82    def check_imbalanced_dataset(self, node: nodes.Module):
 83        imbalance_handling = False
 84        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
 85            if any(method in call.func.as_string() for method in ['SMOTE', 'class_weight', 'StratifiedKFold']):
 86                imbalance_handling = True
 87                break
 88        if not imbalance_handling:
 89            self.smells.append("No imbalanced dataset handling detected. Consider techniques like SMOTE or class weights if dealing with imbalanced data.")
 90
 91    def check_feature_selection(self, node: nodes.Module):
 92        feature_selection = False
 93        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
 94            if any(method in call.func.as_string() for method in ['SelectKBest', 'RFE', 'SelectFromModel']):
 95                feature_selection = True
 96                break
 97        if feature_selection:
 98            self.smells.append("Feature selection detected. Ensure it's applied with proper validation.")
 99
100    def check_metric_selection(self, node: nodes.Module):
101        metrics = set()
102        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
103            if 'metric' in call.func.as_string().lower():
104                metrics.add(call.func.as_string())
105        if 'accuracy_score' in metrics and len(metrics) == 1:
106            self.smells.append("Only accuracy metric detected. Consider using additional metrics for a more comprehensive evaluation.")
107
108    def check_model_persistence(self, node: nodes.Module):
109        model_save = False
110        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
111            if 'save' in call.func.as_string() or 'dump' in call.func.as_string():
112                model_save = True
113                break
114        if model_save:
115            self.smells.append("Model saving detected. Ensure proper versioning and saving of preprocessing steps.")
116
117    def check_reproducibility(self, node: nodes.Module):
118        seed_set = False
119        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
120            if 'random_state' in call.as_string() or 'seed' in call.as_string():
121                seed_set = True
122                break
123        if not seed_set:
124            self.smells.append("No random seed setting detected. Consider setting seeds for reproducibility.")
125
126    def check_data_loading(self, node: nodes.Module):
127        for call in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Call):
128            if 'read_csv' in call.func.as_string() or 'load_data' in call.func.as_string():
129                self.smells.append("Data loading detected. For large datasets, consider using generators or batch processing.")
130
131    def check_unused_features(self, node: nodes.Module):
132        # This is a simplistic check. A more comprehensive check would involve tracking feature usage across the entire pipeline.
133        features = set()
134        used_features = set()
135        for assign in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Assign):
136            if isinstance(assign.targets[0], nodes.Name):
137                features.add(assign.targets[0].name)
138        for name in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Name):
139            used_features.add(name.name)
140        unused = features - used_features
141        if unused:
142            self.smells.append(f"Potentially unused features detected: {', '.join(unused)}")
143
144    def check_overfit_prone_practices(self, node: nodes.Module):
145        for func in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.FunctionDef):
146            if 'feature_engineering' in func.name.lower() and 'train' not in func.name.lower():
147                self.smells.append("Feature engineering function detected. Ensure it's not applied to the entire dataset to avoid data leakage.")
148
149    def check_error_handling(self, node: nodes.Module):
150        try_except = False
151        for block in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Try):
152            try_except = True
153            break
154        if not try_except:
155            self.smells.append("No error handling detected in data processing. Consider adding try-except blocks for robustness.")
156            
157    def check_hardcoded_filepaths(self, node: nodes.Module):
158        for string in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.Const):
159            if isinstance(string.value, str) and ('/' in string.value or '\\' in string.value):
160                self.smells.append(f"Hardcoded file path detected: {string.value}")
161
162    def check_documentation(self, node: nodes.Module):
163        for func in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.FunctionDef):
164            if not isinstance(func.doc_node, nodes.Const):
165                self.smells.append(f"Missing docstring for function: {func.name}")
166        for cls in node.nodes_of_class(nodes.ClassDef):
167            if not isinstance(cls.doc_node, nodes.Const):
168                self.smells.append(f"Missing docstring for class: {cls.name}")
169
